item.title: Imperial Sailing Cosy up at Oxford Magnum
item.author: Anita Plumley,
item.description: Last weekend Imperial Sailing sent their first team to Farmoor Reservoir for the annual, invite-only Oxford Magnum. The weekend really started on the Friday evening, when most of the team (cough Eve cough) made their way to the Commodore’s house for a last-minute R&T (Raclette and Theory) sesh. …

item.title: Imperial Sailing invades Warwick and takes on the Turtle
item.author: Marta Nunes De Abreu,Anita Plumley,
item.description: The weekend started earlier for some members of Imperial Sailing, as they left the lecture theatres, packed up their sailing bags and drove up to Warwick on the Friday night. The specially appointed driver (Toby) was trusted with towing two of the club’s boats that Warwick Sailing Club had borrowed, …

item.title: Imperial Sailing takes on the Wet Dream
item.author: Anita Plumley,
item.description: On Friday 26th October, most of the 2nd and 3rd Imperial sailing teams met at Victoria Coach Station to make our way to compete at the Wet Dream in Reading. Stragglers were forced to take the train, which ultimately proved to be much faster (but less fun) than the coach. We entertained ourselves on …
